'It is as I feared: they have somehow modified the runes, sapping them of their power. 'The island in the lake is called the Stone of Wakening, for it is said that Durin awoke there, first of all the dwarves. He built an anvil of black stone and a forge of white brick, and the sound of his hammer echoing over the water called forth the ancient fathers of the dwarves. They stood on the shore of the lake, observing his work.

'Stóthkell would have loved to stand here, [placeholder]. He spoke of it often, and my heart is aggrieved to know now that he never will.

'Let us cross to the Wakening Stone and see the black anvil and the white forge on his behalf. The bridge is just to the south.'
